## Magical Mathematics: The Mathematical Ideas That Animate Great Magic Tricks

##### Spring 2025

:::{.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"}
##### About the Book

This book reveals the rich mathematical ideas that make great magic tricks work. Explaining the mathematics behind a startling card trick or a mind-reading number act can enhance your appreciation of both the magic and the mathematics.

Written by Persi Diaconis (a professional magician who is also one of the world's leading mathematicians) and Ron Graham (a renowned mathematician who is also a skilled magician), this book explores how mathematical principles underpin the magic tricks that have captivated audiences for centuries.
:::

:::{.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"}
##### Target Audience

This reading group is perfect for:
- Mathematics enthusiasts who enjoy magic
- Magicians interested in the mathematical principles behind their craft
- Anyone fascinated by the intersection of mathematics and entertainment
:::

:::{.callout-tip collapse="true" icon="false"}
##### Prerequisites

Basic comfort with mathematical reasoning. No prior experience with magic is required!
:::

:::{.callout-tip collapse="true" icon="false"}
##### References

1. *Magical Mathematics: The Mathematical Ideas That Animate Great Magic Tricks* by Persi Diaconis and Ron Graham
2. Additional materials will be shared during the sessions
:::

:::{.callout-caution collapse="true" icon="false"}
##### Timings and Venue

We meet every Saturday at 4 PM IST. Join us in Room 1/201 or via Zoom.
